There is danger of spending far too much money on machinery and appliances which the patients can never use in their home lessons. They should rather be taught how to regulate the diet, so that the living machinery of the whole being will work in harmony. Let them become intelligent in regard to the importance of laying 


                         -179  - 

aside corsets and shortening their skirts. Such lessons will be to the women more valuable than they can estimate. 


                           (Signed) Ellen G. White.
